sen.j: 三隅 研次（みすみ けんじ、1921年3月2日 - 1975年9月24日）は映画監督。
sen.e: Kenji MISUMI (March 2, 1921 - November 24, 1975) was a movie director.
Kenji MISUMI (March 2, 1921 - November 24, 1975) was a movie director.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kenji MISUMI (March 2, 1921 - September 24, 1975) was a movie director.
sen.cmt: 9月に修正しました。

sen.j: 代表作は、勝新太郎を主演に起用した座頭市や、市川雷蔵 (8代目)主演の「剣」三部作、眠狂四郎映画版 (1963年-1969年)など。
sen.e: His representative movies include Zatoichi starring Shintaro KATSU, the trilogy of "Ken" starring Raizo ICHIKAWA VIII, and Nemuri Kyoshiro movie versions (1963 - 1969).
His representative movies include Zatoichi starring Shintaro KATSU, the trilogy of "Ken" starring Raizo ICHIKAWA VIII, and Nemuri Kyoshiro movie versions (1963 - 1969).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His representative movies include Zatoichi starring Shintaro KATSU, the trilogy of 'Ken' starring Raizo ICHIKAWA VIII, and Nemuri Kyoshiro series (1963 - 1969).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

tit.cmt: 統一リストに従って修正

sen.j: 神戸の海運業者の父親と、京都の芸妓の母親との間に妾腹の子として京都市に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Kyoto as an illegitimate child between father who was a shipping agent in Kobe and mother who was a geisha in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto as an illegitimate child between a father who was a shipping agent in Kobe, and a mother who was a geisha in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: He was born in Kyoto as an illegitimate child to a father who was a shipping agent in Kobe, and a mother who was a geisha in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 神戸市出生との説もあり、成人するまで母親に一度も会うことなく育った。
sen.e: He had not seen his mother until he became an adult, and It is also said that he was born in Kobe.
He did not see his mother until he became an adult, and it is also said that he was born in Kobe.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Kobe is also a possible birthplace of Misumi, who had never seen his mother until he became an adult.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 立命館大学専門部商科卒業後、日活京都撮影所に助監督として入社。
sen.e: After graduated from Department of Commerce of Specialized Division of Ritsumeikan University, he entered the Nikkatsu Kyoto Studio as an assistant director.
After graduating from a special department of the Department of Commerce, Ritsumeikan University, he entered the Nikkatsu Kyoto Studios as an assistant director.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: After graduating from the Specialized Department of Commerce, Ritsumeikan University, he entered the Nikkatsu Kyoto Studios as an assistant director.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 戦局の悪化にともなって召集され満州へ配属される。
sen.e: As the state of the war was worsening, he was conscripted and assigned to Manchuria.
As the state of the war was worsening, he was conscripted and assigned to Manchuria.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: As the state of the war was worsening, he was drafted into the army and sent to Manchuria.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 戦後三年余りシベリアで抑留生活を送った。
sen.e: He was interned in Siberia for three years after the war.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was interned in Siberia for three years after the war.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was held as a detainee in Siberia for three years after the war.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: そこでの過酷な経験や人間観察が、自身の屈折した生い立ちと相まって後の作風を形作ることとなった。
sen.e: His severe experience and people-watching in the life in a detention camp had formed his style later, combined with his adverse background.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His severe experiences and people-watching during life in a detention camp had formed his style, and later became combined with his adverse background.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: This harsh experience and observation of people in the detention camp combined with his adverse background had formed his style of filmmaking.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 復員後は大映に籍を置き、伊藤大輔 (映画監督)、松田定次、衣笠貞之助らに師事した。
sen.e: After repatriated, he affiliated himself with the Daiei film company, looking up to Daisuke ITO (movie director), Sadatsugu MATSUDA, Teinosuke KINUGASA, and others as his teachers.
After repatriation, he affiliated himself with the Daiei film company, looking up to Daisuke ITO (movie director), Sadatsugu MATSUDA, Teinosuke KINUGASA, and others as his teachers.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: After repatriation, he affiliated himself with the Daiei film company, studied under Daisuke ITO (movie director), Sadatsugu MATSUDA, Teinosuke KINUGASA, and others.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 監督デビュー作は『丹下左膳・こけ猿の壺』（1954年）。
sen.e: He debuted as a movie director with "Tange Sazen: Kokezaru no tsubo"(1954).
He debuted as a movie director with "Tange Sazen: Kokezaru no tsubo"(1954).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His directorial debut was a movie entitled "Tange Sazen: Kokezaru no tsubo"(1954).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 田中徳三、池広一夫と共に「大映三羽烏」と称された。
sen.e: Together with Tokuzo TANAKA and Kazuo IKEHIRO, he was one of the "Daiei trio".

sen.e: Together with Tokuzo TANAKA and Kazuo IKEHIRO, he was one of the "Daiei trio".
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Together with Tokuzo TANAKA and Kazuo IKEHIRO, he was one of the 'Daiei trio.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 全盛時の大映京都撮影所を支える主力監督としてプログラムピクチャーを撮り続ける。
sen.e: He went on taking program pictures as a leading director who supported the heydays of the Daiei Kyoto Studio.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He continued making programs as a leading director who supported the heyday of the Daiei Kyoto Studio.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: He continued making short and mid-length movies for double or triple-feature programs as a leading director who supported the heyday of the Daiei Kyoto Studio.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: また国産初の70ミリ映画『釈迦』の監督も務めた。
sen.e: He also directed the movie "Shaka (Buddha)" the first domestically produced 70 mm film.
He also directed the movie "Shaka (Buddha)", the first domestically produced 70 mm film.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: He also directed the movie "Shaka (Buddha)," the first 70 mm film produced in Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 大映倒産後は映像京都の立ち上げに参加した。
sen.e: After Daiei went bankrupt, he participated in the establishment of Eizo Kyoto Film Co..

sen.e: After Daiei went bankrupt, he participated in the establishment of Eizo Kyoto Film Co..

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: テレビシリーズを手がける傍ら、勝プロ＝大映京都撮影所（配給は東宝）で数本の劇場用作品を完成させる。
sen.e: While directing TV series, he completed several theatrical films with Katsu Production Co.Ltd. - Daiei Kyoto Studio (released by Toho Co.Ltd.)

sen.e: While directing some TV series, he also completed several theatrical films with Katsu Production Co., Ltd. - Daiei Kyoto Studio (released by Toho Co., Ltd.).

sen.j: 初の他社撮影所（松竹大船）での劇場映画『狼よ落日を斬れ』を完成させた直後の1975年、肝癌のため死去。
sen.e: Upon completed the theatrical film "Okami yo Rakujitsu wo Kire" at the other company's studio (Shochiku's Ofuna) for the first time, he died of liver cancer in 1975.

sen.j: 享年54という若さであった。
sen.e: He died young at the age of 54.
He died young at the age of 54.

sen.j: 「座頭市」シリーズや、「剣」三部作、「眠狂四郎」シリーズなどの作品により、時代劇の巨匠監督の地位を得た。
sen.e: He established his position as a great period film director by the "Zatoichi" series, the trilogy of "Ken", "Nemuri Kyoshiro" series and the like.
He established his position as a great period film director by the "Zatoichi" series, the trilogy of "Ken", "Nemuri Kyoshiro" series and the like.

sen.e: He earned his position as a master of period film with the 'Zatoichi' series, the trilogy of 'Ken,' 'Nemuri Kyoshiro' series and the like.

sen.j: また、若山富三郎を主役に据えた映画版『子連れ狼 (若山富三郎版)』における鮮烈な殺陣シーンなどは、クエンティン・タランティーノやサム・ライミにも大きな影響を与えたとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the spectacular sword-fight scenes in the movie version "Kozure Okami (Tomisaburo WAKAYAMA version)" starring Tomisaburo WAKAYAMA made a big impact even on Quentin Tarantine and Sam Raimi.
